characteristics_prey: Lizards, fish, frogs, and other snakes
characteristics_biggest_threat: The cane toad, whose venom is toxic to red-bellied black snakes.
characteristics_most_distinctive_feature: The top part of its body is a shiny solid black, while the underbelly is several shades of red
characteristics_other_name(s): Common black snake, red-belly, RBBS, and several indigenous names, including "djirrabidi"
characteristics_habitat: Woodlands, grasslands, forests, swamps and other wetlands, streams, and shallow rivers
characteristics_distinctive_feature: Female red-bellied black snakes have a different hinge mechanism in their jaw from males.

name: Red-Eared Slider
characteristics_prey: Insects and their larvae, spiders, crawfish, freshwater clams and sponges, eggs, snails, fish, slugs, small amphibians and reptiles
characteristics_most_distinctive_feature: The red stripe behind its ear
characteristics_other_name(s): none
characteristics_habitat: In forests or savannas near freshwater bodies. The water needs to be shallow, sluggish and full of plant and animal life and places for the turtle to bask.
characteristics_length: 5 to 8 inches but can grow to 12 inches. Females are larger.
characteristics_age_of_sexual_maturity: Two to five years for males, five to eight years for females
characteristics_predators: Snakes, alligators, waterbirds, crows, opossums, large fish, skunks, raccoons, minks, otters, foxes, armadillos, coyotes and humans. White tailed deer and foxes eat their eggs.

name: Rhombic Egg-Eater Snake
characteristics_most_distinctive_feature: These snakes don't have teeth! Instead, they have ridges in their mouth and throat to hold eggs and projections in their spine to pierce the shell.
characteristics_other_name(s): Egg-eating snake or the common egg-eater
characteristics_habitat: These snakes thrive almost anywhere except in extreme deserts and in forests with closed canopies.
characteristics_distinctive_feature: Dark rhomboid-shaped spots on its back

name: Ribbon Snake
characteristics_special_features: Brown, black, olive with a tan, white, blue or yellow stripe

name: River Jack Snake
characteristics_prey: Rodents, amphibians, fish, and other small mammals

name: Rough Green Snake
characteristics_prey: Insects, snails, spiders, and small frogs
characteristics_other_name(s): Grass snake and green grass snake

name: Rubber Boa
characteristics_special_features: Solid brown, yellow belly with brown spots

name: Russian Tortoise
characteristics_other_name(s): Central Asian Tortoise, Afghan Tortoise, Steppe Tortoise
characteristics_favorite_food: grasses, flowers, leaves and other vegetation

name: Sand Lizard
characteristics_slogan: Males turn green in spring!
characteristics_distinctive_feature: Striped patterned body and forked tongue

name: Sand Viper
characteristics_other_name(s): Saharan Sand Viper, Common Sand Viper

name: Satanic leaf-tailed gecko
characteristics_estimated_population_siz: Unknown, conservation status is Least Concern
characteristics_other_name(s): Eyelash leaf-tailed gecko, phantastic leaf-tailed gecko

name: Scarlet Kingsnake
characteristics_prey: Lizards, other snakes, birds and their eggs, rodents
characteristics_other_name(s): scarlet milk snake

name: Sea Turtle
characteristics_slogan: Always return to the same beach to lay eggs!

name: Sharp-Tailed Snake
characteristics_other_name(s): Pacific brown snake, gentle brown snake
characteristics_habitat: Moist areas including woodlands, forests, grasslands
characteristics_location: Western part of the United States, British Columbia

name: Skink Lizard
characteristics_prey: Flies, crickets, grasshoppers, beetles, and caterpillars
characteristics_most_distinctive_feature: Lizard-like body with short legs or no legs at all
characteristics_other_name(s): Skinks
characteristics_predators: Foxes, raccoons, opossums, skunks, shrews, moles, birds

name: Snake
characteristics_slogan: There are around 3,000 known species worldwide

name: Snapping Turtle
characteristics_slogan: Only found in North America!

name: Snouted Cobra
characteristics_prey: Birds, lizards, rodents, toads, and other snakes

name: Southern Pacific Rattlesnake
characteristics_prey: Lizards, birds, snakes, frogs, and small mammals including rats, mice, rabbits, and ground squirrels.
characteristics_most_distinctive_feature: Rattle composed of interlocking keratin links.
characteristics_habitat: scrub brush, coastal sage, rocky hills
characteristics_lifestyle: NocturnalCrepuscularNocturnal/Crepuscularor Nocturnal Depending on Region and Season
characteristics_location: Southern California from Santa Barbara County south to northern Baja California and the Santa Catalina Islands.
characteristics_distinctive_feature: Large, triangular head and narrow neck.
characteristics_main_prey: Rats, mice, rabbits, and ground squirrels.

name: Spider-Tailed Horned Viper
characteristics_prey: Prefers birds but will also eat lizards, rodents, and arthropods

name: Spitting Cobra
characteristics_prey: Small mammals, amphibians, reptiles, insects, eggs, birds. Some species scavenge.

name: Stiletto Snake
characteristics_other_name(s): Southern stiletto snake, Bibron's stiletto snake, Side-stabbing snake, Bibron's burrowing asp, Bibron's mole viper.
characteristics_habitat: fynbos, karoo scrub, semi-desert, savannahs, grasslands, woodlands, and forests
characteristics_length: 12-16 inches, though it may reach 21.75 inches

name: Sulcata Tortoise
characteristics_estimated_population_siz: Unknown, but the animal is listed as vulnerable or endangered
characteristics_other_name(s): African spurred tortoise
characteristics_common_name: African spurred tortoise, spurred tortoise, African spur thigh tortoise
characteristics_location: Southern part of the Sahara Desert

name: Texas Indigo Snake
characteristics_most_distinctive_feature: Iridescent blueish sheen in the light.
characteristics_other_name(s): Texas blue indigo, blue indigo snake, indigo snake
characteristics_habitat: Grasslands, brush, forests in Texas, from San Antonio south, and into northern Mexico as far south as Veracruz.
characteristics_predators: Birds of prey like hawks and eagles

name: Texas Rat Snake
characteristics_prey: Rodents, reptiles, frogs, birds, eggs, and insects
characteristics_habitat: forests, grasslands, swamps, and suburban and urban areas.
characteristics_location: south-central region of the United States

name: Texas Spiny Lizard
characteristics_other_name(s): Tree lizard, fence lizard

name: Tiger Rattlesnake
characteristics_other_name(s): Tiger rattler
characteristics_location: Central Arizona south to northern Mexico
characteristics_distinctive_feature: "Tiger stripes" in the form of crossbands down the length of the snake
characteristics_main_prey: Adults - mainly small mammals; juveniles - mainly lizards

name: Timber Rattlesnake (Canebrake Rattlesnake)
characteristics_favorite_food: Rodents, shrews, rabbits, amphibians, and birds
characteristics_special_features: Dark zig-zag patterns set against brown, gray, or pinkish skin

name: Tree Snake
characteristics_other_name(s): Cat snake
characteristics_distinctive_feature: A large head compared to its slender body
characteristics_nesting_location: In a crevice or beneath a rock to keep them cool

name: Tuatara
characteristics_slogan: Only found on a few of New Zealand's islands!

name: Urutu Snake
characteristics_habitat: Rainforests and humid regions of Brazil, Argentina, Paraguay, and Uruguay
characteristics_common_name: Yarará grande, víbora de la cruz, urutu, wutu, crossed pit viper
characteristics_predators: Humans capture them for the pet trade
characteristics_distinctive_feature: Chocolate brown pattern with white or cream borders

name: Virgin Islands Dwarf Gecko
characteristics_other_name(s): Virgin Islands Dwarf Sphaero and Virgin Gorda Least Gecko

name: Water Dragon
characteristics_slogan: Spends most of it's time in the trees!

name: Western Diamondback Rattlesnake
characteristics_other_name(s): Western diamond-backed rattlesnake, adobe snake, Arizona diamond rattlesnake, coon tail, desert diamond-back, desert diamond rattlesnake, fierce rattlesnake, spitting rattlesnake, buzz tail, Texan rattlesnake, Texas diamond-back, and Texas rattler.
characteristics_lifestyle: NocturnalDiurnalCrepuscularor Nocturnal Depending on Region and Seasonterrestrial
characteristics_distinctive_feature: Large, spade-shaped head and diamond-shaped markings on their back.

name: Western Hognose Snake
characteristics_common_name: Blow snake, hognose snake, faux viper

name: Western Rat Snake
characteristics_prey: Lizards, rats, mice, birds, squirrels, chipmunks
characteristics_most_distinctive_feature: Adults have glossy black bodies that sometimes show faint patterns.
characteristics_other_name(s): western rat snake, black rat snake, pilot black snake, black snake
characteristics_habitat: Rocky hillsides, farmland, abandoned buildings, forested areas
characteristics_lifestyle: Diurnalor Nocturnal Depending on Region and Season

name: Whiptail Lizard
characteristics_other_name(s): Racerunner
characteristics_location: North America, Central America, South America, West Indies

name: Worm Snake
characteristics_prey: Caterpillars, snails, slugs, and other soft-bodied invertebrates
characteristics_most_distinctive_feature: They have spiked tails but they don't sting!
characteristics_other_name(s): Blind snakes, thunder snakes, milk snakes, eastern twig snakes, and cricket snakes
characteristics_distinctive_feature: Narrow, cone-shaped heads
characteristics_nesting_location: Abandoned burrows, in decaying wood, or under rocks

name: Yarara
characteristics_prey: Youngers snakes eat insects, toads, frogs and smaller reptiles. Adults prefer rodents and other small mammals.
characteristics_most_distinctive_feature: Vivid brown to black trapezoidal marks edged in white or cream
characteristics_habitat: South American forests, marshes, swamps, grasslands, and riverine habitats
characteristics_common_name: Yarara, crossed pit viper, urutu, wutu
characteristics_predators: Birds of prey, including the burrowing owls
characteristics_distinctive_feature: The snake's belly is pale with a single dark stripe that runs the entire length of its body

name: Yellow Anaconda
characteristics_prey: capybara, peccaries, caimans, fish, birds, small deer
characteristics_biggest_threat: People hunting them for skins and in retaliation for livestock predation
characteristics_other_name(s): Paraguayan anaconda, yakumama, matatoro, sucuri
characteristics_distinctive_feature: Dorsal blotches, noticeably yellow base color

name: Yellow Spotted Lizard
characteristics_other_name(s): Yellow-spotted tropical night lizard, yellow-spotted night lizard.
characteristics_habitat: Rainforests, tropical dry forests, subtropical wet forests, and in water.

name: Zebra Snake
characteristics_prey: rodents, birds, fish, eggs, other reptiles
characteristics_common_name: western barred spitting cobra, zebra cobra, zebra snake

name: Blood Python
characteristics_length: 5–8 feet; females are larger than males

name: Box Turtle
characteristics_biggest_threat: Habitat loss, automobiles on the road
characteristics_predators: Dogs, skunks, raccoons, snakes and some birds

name: Burmese Python
characteristics_most_distinctive_feature: These snakes have puzzle like patches all over the skin.
characteristics_habitat: Natives of jungles and grassy marshes of Southeast Asia
characteristics_location: Native to Asia and can be found from eastern India through Vietnam and southern China. Can also be found in the islands of Java, Bali, small parts of Sulawesi, Sumbawa, and Florida (United States).

name: Bush Viper
characteristics_litter_size: Between nine and 12 at a time

name: Cottonmouth
characteristics_prey: Fish, rodents, shrews, frogs, reptiles, birds, insects, and eggs

name: Crested Gecko
characteristics_biggest_threat: Habitat destruction, introduction of invasive species.
characteristics_most_distinctive_feature: The fringed crests that shade their eyes and run down the back and over the legs
characteristics_other_name(s): New Caledonian crested gecko, eyelash gecko
characteristics_predators: Fire ants, dogs, cats, snakes, rats, other geckos

name: Crocodile
characteristics_most_distinctive_feature: Eyes and nostrils located on top of the head and snout
characteristics_other_name(s): American crocodile, Orinoco crocodile, Freshwater crocodile, Philippine crocodile, Mexican crocodile, Nile crocodile, New Guinea crocodile, Mugger crocodile, Estuarine crocodile, Cuban crocodile, Siamese crocodile, Dwarf crocodile, Slender-snouted crocodile
characteristics_habitat: Rivers, lakes, marshes, lagoons, mangrove swamps and estuaries
characteristics_location: North, Central and South America, Africa, Asia, Australia
characteristics_slogan: Have changed little in 200 million years!
characteristics_predators: Humans, Large felines, Birds of prey

name: Gecko
characteristics_slogan: There are thought to be over 2,000 species!

name: Nile Crocodile
characteristics_prey: Fish, hippos, zebras, other crocodiles, birds
characteristics_other_name(s): Nile croc
characteristics_age_of_sexual_maturity: Males-relates to their size, Females-10 years old

name: Rock Python
characteristics_prey: Mammals, including warthogs and antelopes and bats, lizards, crocodiles, fish, the cubs of big cats and the pups of wild dogs, pet dogs, pet cats and livestock

characteristics_habitat: Sandy desert plains and rocky hills
characteristics_slogan: Lives in burrows underground!
characteristics_distinctive_feature: Small size and patterned shell

name: Horned Viper
characteristics_other_name(s): horned sand viper and desert horned viper

name: Thorny Devil
characteristics_slogan: Found only on mainland Australia!

name: Wood Turtle
characteristics_prey: Insects, earthworms, small arthropods such as millipedes

characteristics_most_distinctive_feature: The scutes, which have beautiful growth rings
characteristics_other_name(s): Nihonishigameor, ornate wood turtle, Honduran wood turtle, black river turtle, spot-legged turtle, brown land turtle, Splengleri turtle
characteristics_habitat: Deciduous forests, rain forests, marshes, bogs, rivers, streams
characteristics_location: North America, Central America, South America, China, Vietnam, Japan

name: Gopher Tortoise
characteristics_other_name(s): Florida gopher tortoise
characteristics_habitat: Pine Flatwoods, Pine-Oak sandhills, Rocklands, grasslands
characteristics_predators: humans, birds of prey, cats and dogs, coyotes, raccoons, wild boars, bobcats

name: Green Tree Python
characteristics_common_name: Green tree python, southern green python

name: River Turtle
characteristics_slogan: Inhabits freshwater habitats around the world!

name: Spiny Hill Turtle
characteristics_other_name(s): Cogwheel turtle

name: Tortoise
characteristics_slogan: Can live until they are more than 150 years old!

name: Turtles
characteristics_prey: Crabs, jellyfish, squid, shrimp, cuttlefish, sea squirts, sea cucumbers, sponges, seagrass, algae, worms, snails, insect larvae, aquatic insects, crustaceans, water plants, fallen fruit, frogs, snakes, fish and smaller turtles.

characteristics_habitat: Aquatic, muddy, swampy areas, dry land for sun basking

name: Slow Worm
characteristics_slogan: Found widely throughout British gardens!
